response.ExtraField12:
• What are the main benefits of the Corset?
    The Corset is adjustable and has two rows of hook and eye closures in the front that are separated by an inch apart. As your body transforms after your delivery, you can adjust the setting when slightly more or less compression is needed.

    The Corset also has a convenient crotch are closure that allows you to use the restroom or change your underwear and pads comfortably without needing to take it off each time.

  • What is the difference between the Dual Girdle and Corset?
    Both the Corset and Dual-closure are Bellefit’s most popular styles since they can be used after either delivery method and offer the most adjustment options, making them ideal for all body types (Hourglass/Triangle/Rectangle/Hourglass/Oval).

    The Dual-Closure and the Corset are both adjustable and have two rows of front hook and eye closures that are separated by an inch apart. They can be adjusted so as time goes by, you can tighten (or loosen) your girdle when slightly more or less compression is needed. The main difference between the two styles is that the Dual-Closure (also known as a Double Corset) has the side zipper closure as well. Underneath the zipper are two sets of adjustable hook and eye closures (one near the top and one near the bottom).

    The Dual-Closure and the Corset are both adjustable and have two rows of front hook and eye closures that are separated by an inch apart. They can be adjusted so as time goes by, you can tighten (or loosen) your girdle when slightly more or less compression is needed. The main difference between the two styles is that the Dual-Closure (also known as a Double Corset) has the side zipper closure as well. Underneath the zipper are two sets of adjustable hook and eye closures (one near the top and one near the bottom).

    Because it has both closure options, the Dual-Closure is able to be adjusted the most out of all of the other styles. Many moms like having the option of both closures in one girdle to also be able to choose which method is more convenient for them throughout their recovery. For example, in the beginning when your swelling is at its peak, you may find that it is easier for you to use just the front closure. Once you get a little farther along you may find that just using the zipper closure is more convenient for you.

    If you still need help deciding which style is best for you, feel free to give us a call and speak to one of our specialists for personalized size and style suggestions.

  • Can I wear a Corset after a c-section?
    Yes! The front hook and eye closures of the Corset are designed with the incision in mind.

  • Can you see it underneath my clothes?
    The Corset is not bulky and is flush with your skin; however because of the closure location, it may be slightly visible underneath certain fabrics or if you are wearing a fitted top. Keep in mind though that your comfort and healing process is the most important factor!

  • I had a natural delivery. Can I still use the Corset style?
    Yes! The Corset is an excellent option for either delivery method.

  • I am unsure of my delivery method. Is the Corset still recommended?
    Yes! The Corset is an excellent option for either delivery method.

  • I am not pregnant but have had abdominal surgery. Can I still use the Corset style?
    Yes! The Corset is recommended in the case of an abdominal surgery that may or may not be the result of a pregnancy.

  • Is the Corset adjustable?
    Yes. There are two rows of the hook and eye closures that are separated by an inch apart so you can tighten your girdle when more or less compression is needed throughout your recovery.

  • What body type is best for a Corset?
    Since the Corset is adjustable, it is suitable for all body shape types.
    (Triangle/Inverted Triangle/Hourglass/Rectangle)

  • When can I start wearing my Corset?
    Begin wearing your Corset the day that you are discharged from the hospital or as soon as you are ready to wear it after the delivery. It's optimal to begin wearing Bellefit right after birth; however, you will still see results if you begin to wear your girdle at any time during the first 6 months after the delivery. As always, consult with your physician to make sure the Corset is right for you since every recovery process is so unique.

We offer our Bundles where you can order more than one size or style at a discounted rate! When close to or more than 33lbs are gained, we recommend going up one size for the initial stages of the recovery. Most moms do end up needing more than one size to complete their recovery process. Some women also choose a Bundle because they want the flexibility of having more than one style available to wear or just to have a backup to wear while the other one is being washed.

When ordering a bundle of two sizes, always try the smaller girdle first to make sure that the larger one is needed. It is better to have a girdle that may be a little snug at first than one that is too loose.

response.ExtraField12:
When should I purchase a Bundle?
Bellefit Bundles offer savings to women who have gained close to or more than 33lbs during their pregnancy. Women who fall under this category will require 2 sizes in order to receive continuous abdominal compression throughout the childbirth recovery process. Some women choose bundles because they want the flexibility of having more than one style available to wear, and in many cases women also like to have a second girdle to use while washing. During weeks 1-3 after childbirth, the larger-sized girdle is used to provide immediate postpartum compression before going down one size to complete the recovery process. Visit our Bundles page to learn more.

I have had a dramatic weight gain during my pregnancy, what is my best option?
If this is your case then we recommend a Bellefit Bundle, which consists of 2 girdles, one larger for the initial stages of your recovery, and a smaller one after you have dropped one size in order to complete the childbirth recovery process.

I don't know if I will have a c-section or natural birth, what design do I choose?
All four Bellefit girdle designs provide the same benefits; the only difference is the closure method of the girdles. We recommend purchasing a Dual-Closure Girdle if your delivery method is uncertain. The Bellefit Corset is also recommended if your delivery method is uncertain.

What is the difference between the Girdles?
  • Dual The Dual-Closure girdle can be used after a C-section or Natural birth. It combines the closure methods of the Corset and the Girdle with Zipper. The dual-closure girdle has the hooks in the front (as in the corset) and the lateral zipper (as in the girdle with zipper). This girdle is preferred by many Moms who are seeking the highest level of flexibility and adjustability throughout the postpartum recovery process.
  • Corset To protect and accommodate your incision scar, the Corset has hook-and-eye closures in the front. The Corsets are adjustable and have two rows of hook and eye closures that are separated by an inch apart. They can be adjusted so as time goes by, you can tighten your girdle when additional compression is needed. This design is also good for the Moms that are planning a natural birth but a c-section is still possible.
  • Zipper The Girdle with zipper has a lateral zipper which allows for a simple closure for smaller sizes. The Girdle with Zipper is adjustable and has two sets of hook and eye closures underneath the zipper that are separated by an inch apart. They can be adjusted so as time goes by, you can tighten your girdle when additional compression is needed. This design is also good for the Moms that are planning a natural birth but a c-section is still possible. The C-Section Incision must have healed for the Girdle with Zipper to be worn comfortably. For C-Section recovery, it is optimal to use the Corset or Dual Closure.
  • Pull-up The Girdle Pull-Up has a simple and traditional design with no closures, except for the crotch area flap. This style is ideal for Moms that have had a vaginal childbirth and would like this basic and efficient design. The Pull-Up is not recommended for c-section recovery.

response.ExtraField12:
When should I purchase a Bundle?
Bellefit Bundles offer savings to women who have gained close to or more than 33lbs during their pregnancy. Women who fall under this category will require 2 sizes in order to receive continuous abdominal compression throughout the childbirth recovery process. Some women choose bundles because they want the flexibility of having more than one style available to wear, and in many cases women also like to have a second girdle to use while washing. During weeks 1-3 after childbirth, the larger-sized girdle is used to provide immediate postpartum compression before going down one size to complete the recovery process. Visit our Bundles page to learn more.

I have had a dramatic weight gain during my pregnancy, what is my best option?
If this is your case then we recommend a Bellefit Bundle, which consists of 2 girdles, one larger for the initial stages of your recovery, and a smaller one after you have dropped one size in order to complete the childbirth recovery process.

I don't know if I will have a c-section or natural birth, what design do I choose?
All four Bellefit girdle designs provide the same benefits; the only difference is the closure method of the girdles. We recommend purchasing a Dual-Closure Girdle if your delivery method is uncertain. The Bellefit Corset is also recommended if your delivery method is uncertain.

What is the difference between the Girdles?
  • Dual The Dual-Closure girdle can be used after a C-section or Natural birth. It combines the closure methods of the Corset and the Girdle with Zipper. The dual-closure girdle has the hooks in the front (as in the corset) and the lateral zipper (as in the girdle with zipper). This girdle is preferred by many Moms who are seeking the highest level of flexibility and adjustability throughout the postpartum recovery process.
  • Corset To protect and accommodate your incision scar, the Corset has hook-and-eye closures in the front. The Corsets are adjustable and have two rows of hook and eye closures that are separated by an inch apart. They can be adjusted so as time goes by, you can tighten your girdle when additional compression is needed. This design is also good for the Moms that are planning a natural birth but a c-section is still possible.
  • Zipper The Girdle with zipper has a lateral zipper which allows for a simple closure for smaller sizes. The Girdle with Zipper is adjustable and has two sets of hook and eye closures underneath the zipper that are separated by an inch apart. They can be adjusted so as time goes by, you can tighten your girdle when additional compression is needed. This design is also good for the Moms that are planning a natural birth but a c-section is still possible. The C-Section Incision must have healed for the Girdle with Zipper to be worn comfortably. For C-Section recovery, it is optimal to use the Corset or Dual Closure.
  • Pull-up The Girdle Pull-Up has a simple and traditional design with no closures, except for the crotch area flap. This style is ideal for Moms that have had a vaginal childbirth and would like this basic and efficient design. The Pull-Up is not recommended for c-section recovery.

response.ExtraField12:
When should I purchase a Bundle?
Bellefit Bundles offer savings to women who have gained close to or more than 33lbs during their pregnancy. Women who fall under this category will require 2 sizes in order to receive continuous abdominal compression throughout the childbirth recovery process. Some women choose bundles because they want the flexibility of having more than one style available to wear, and in many cases women also like to have a second girdle to use while washing. During weeks 1-3 after childbirth, the larger-sized girdle is used to provide immediate postpartum compression before going down one size to complete the recovery process. Visit our Bundles page to learn more.

I have had a dramatic weight gain during my pregnancy, what is my best option?
If this is your case then we recommend a Bellefit Bundle, which consists of 2 girdles, one larger for the initial stages of your recovery, and a smaller one after you have dropped one size in order to complete the childbirth recovery process.

I don't know if I will have a c-section or natural birth, what design do I choose?
All four Bellefit girdle designs provide the same benefits; the only difference is the closure method of the girdles. We recommend purchasing a Dual-Closure Girdle if your delivery method is uncertain. The Bellefit Corset is also recommended if your delivery method is uncertain.

What is the difference between the Girdles?
  • Dual The Dual-Closure girdle can be used after a C-section or Natural birth. It combines the closure methods of the Corset and the Girdle with Zipper. The dual-closure girdle has the hooks in the front (as in the corset) and the lateral zipper (as in the girdle with zipper). This girdle is preferred by many Moms who are seeking the highest level of flexibility and adjustability throughout the postpartum recovery process.
  • Corset To protect and accommodate your incision scar, the Corset has hook-and-eye closures in the front. The Corsets are adjustable and have two rows of hook and eye closures that are separated by an inch apart. They can be adjusted so as time goes by, you can tighten your girdle when additional compression is needed. This design is also good for the Moms that are planning a natural birth but a c-section is still possible.
  • Zipper The Girdle with zipper has a lateral zipper which allows for a simple closure for smaller sizes. The Girdle with Zipper is adjustable and has two sets of hook and eye closures underneath the zipper that are separated by an inch apart. They can be adjusted so as time goes by, you can tighten your girdle when additional compression is needed. This design is also good for the Moms that are planning a natural birth but a c-section is still possible. The C-Section Incision must have healed for the Girdle with Zipper to be worn comfortably. For C-Section recovery, it is optimal to use the Corset or Dual Closure.
  • Pull-up The Girdle Pull-Up has a simple and traditional design with no closures, except for the crotch area flap. This style is ideal for Moms that have had a vaginal childbirth and would like this basic and efficient design. The Pull-Up is not recommended for c-section recovery.

The option of a lateral zipper and the hook and eye closures in the front provides the most flexibility after a c-section or natural delivery.
response.Keywords: double corset girdle, dual closure girdle, post pregnancy double corset, postpartum corset
response.ExtraField6:
Directions
Begin wearing after birth on the day that you are discharged from the hospital. It's optimal to begin wearing Bellefit right after birth; however, you will still see results if you begin to wear your girdle at any time during the first 6 months after the delivery.

Here's why: Still present after childbirth for up to 6 months are hormones secreted during pregnancy. These hormones, Estrogen, progesterone and relaxin loosen the abdominal muscles, the pelvic structure and supporting ligaments and joints. Bellefit works together with your body's natural process of recovery.

The Girdle/Corset acts to retract the body by drawing in stretched muscles and provides medical-grade compression to your abdominal area. We have even heard great testimonies from Moms that began using Bellefit up to 8-10 months postpartum and were able to benefit greatly from its use.

response.ExtraField12:
• What is the difference between the Corset and the Dual-Closure?
    The Dual Closure has two rows of hook and eye closures in the front that are separated by an inch apart and a lateral zipper on the side with two sets of hook and eye closures underneath. .

    As your body transforms after your delivery, you can adjust the settings when slightly more or less compression is needed. Many moms love the option of both closures to not only get the highest level for flexibility, but to also decide which closure method is most convenient throughout the recovery process.

    The Dual-Closure also has a convenient crotch are closure that allows you to use the restroom or change your underwear and pads comfortably without needing to take it off each time.

  • Can I wear a Dual-Closure after a c-section?
    Yes! The front hook and eye closures of the Dual-Closure are designed with the incision in mind.

  • What are the main benefits of the Dual-Closure?
    The main difference between the two styles is that the Dual-Closure (also known as a Double Corset) has the side zipper closure as well. Underneath the zipper are two sets of adjustable hook and eye closures (one near the top and one near the bottom).

    Because it has both closure options, the Dual-Closure is able to be adjusted the most out of all of the other styles. Many moms like having the option of both closures in one girdle to also be able to choose which method is more convenient for them throughout their recovery. For example, in the beginning when your swelling is at its peak, you may find that it is easier for you to use just the front closure. Once you get a little farther along you may find that just using the zipper closure is more convenient for you.

  • Can I wear a Dual-Closure after a c-section?
    Yes! The front hook and eye closures of the Dual-Closure are designed with the incision in mind.

  • I had a natural delivery. Can I still use the Dual-Closure style?
    Yes! The Dual-Closure is an excellent option for either delivery method.

  • I am unsure of my delivery method. Is the Dual-Closure still recommended?
    Yes! The Dual-Closure is an excellent option for either delivery method.

  • Can you see it underneath my clothes?
    The Dual-Closure is not bulky and is flush with your skin; however because of the front closure location, it may be slightly visible underneath certain fabrics or if you are wearing a fitted top. Keep in mind though that your comfort and healing process is the most important factor!

  • I am not pregnant but have had abdominal surgery. Can I still use the Dual-Closure style?
    Yes! Keep in mind though that we generally recommend a Girdle with Hooks (Corset) after an abdominal surgery that may or may not be related to pregnancy. As always, consult with your physician to make sure that a compression garment is the best choice for your recovery.

  • Is the Dual-Closure adjustable?
    The Dual Closure has two rows of hook and eye closures in the front that are separated by an inch apart and a lateral zipper on the side with two sets of hook and eye closures underneath.

    As your body transforms after your delivery, you can adjust the settings when slightly more or less compression is needed.

  • What body type is best for a Dual-Closure?
    Since the Dual-Closure is adjustable, it is suitable for all body type shapes. (Triangle/Inverted Triangle/Hourglass/Rectangle)

  • When can I start wearing my Dual-Closure?
    Begin wearing your Dual-Closure the day that you are discharged from the hospital or as soon as you are ready to wear it after the delivery. It's optimal to begin wearing Bellefit right after birth; however, you will still see results if you begin to wear your girdle at any time during the first 6 months after the delivery. As always, consult with your physician to make sure the Dual-Closure is right for you since every recovery process is so unique.

Some women choose bundles because they want the flexibility of having more than one style available to wear, and in many cases women also like to have a second girdle to use while washing. During weeks 1-3 after childbirth, the larger-sized girdle is used to provide immediate postpartum compression before going down one size to complete the recovery process. Visit our Bundles page to learn more.

I have had a dramatic weight gain during my pregnancy, what is my best option?
If this is your case then we recommend a Bellefit Bundle, which consists of 2 girdles, one larger for the initial stages of your recovery, and a smaller one after you have dropped one size in order to complete the childbirth recovery process.

I don't know if I will have a c-section or natural birth, what design do I choose?
All four Bellefit girdle designs provide the same benefits; the only difference is the closure method of the girdles. We recommend purchasing a Dual-Closure Girdle if your delivery method is uncertain. The Bellefit Corset is also recommended if your delivery method is uncertain.

What is the difference between the Girdles?
  • Dual The Dual-Closure girdle can be used after a C-section or Natural birth. It combines the closure methods of the Corset and the Girdle with Zipper. The dual-closure girdle has the hooks in the front (as in the corset) and the lateral zipper (as in the girdle with zipper). This girdle is preferred by many Moms who are seeking the highest level of flexibility and adjustability throughout the postpartum recovery process.
  • Corset To protect and accommodate your incision scar, the Corset has hook-and-eye closures in the front. The Corsets are adjustable and have two rows of hook and eye closures that are separated by an inch apart. They can be adjusted so as time goes by, you can tighten your girdle when additional compression is needed. This design is also good for the Moms that are planning a natural birth but a c-section is still possible.
  • Zipper The Girdle with zipper has a lateral zipper which allows for a simple closure for smaller sizes. The Girdle with Zipper is adjustable and has two sets of hook and eye closures underneath the zipper that are separated by an inch apart. They can be adjusted so as time goes by, you can tighten your girdle when additional compression is needed. This design is also good for the Moms that are planning a natural birth but a c-section is still possible. The C-Section Incision must have healed for the Girdle with Zipper to be worn comfortably. For C-Section recovery, it is optimal to use the Corset or Dual Closure.
  • Pull-up The Girdle Pull-Up has a simple and traditional design with no closures, except for the crotch area flap. This style is ideal for Moms that have had a vaginal childbirth and would like this basic and efficient design. The Pull-Up is not recommended for c-section recovery.

response.Description:
The Bellefit Bundle #10 includes one Dual-Closure Girdle and One Girdle Pull-up

Why a bundle?
We offer our Bundles where you can order more than one size or style at a discounted rate! When close to or more than 33lbs are gained, we recommend going up one size for the initial stages of the recovery. Most moms do end up needing more than one size to complete their recovery process. Some women also choose a Bundle because they want the flexibility of having more than one style available to wear or just to have a backup to wear while the other one is being washed.

When ordering a bundle of two sizes, always try the smaller girdle first to make sure that the larger one is needed. It is better to have a girdle that may be a little snug at first than one that is too loose.
response.ExtraField6:
Dual-Closure Features:
The Dual-Closure girdle combines the benefits of the Corset and the Girdle with Zipper in one girdle. The option of a lateral zipper and the hook and eye closures in the front allow you to choose which closure method is more convenient for you. The hook and eye closures can be adjusted so as time goes by, you can tighten your girdle when additional compression is needed.

The Dual-Closure provides the most flexibility that is ideal for after a C-Section or natural delivery.

Girdle Pull-up Features:
The Girdle Pull-up has a simple and traditional design without any hooks or zippers. Ideal for Moms that have a natural delivery and would like this basic and efficient design.

Please keep in mind that the Pull-up is the only girdle not recommended in the case of a c-section.

Directions
Begin wearing after birth on the day that you are discharged from the hospital. It's optimal to begin wearing Bellefit right after birth; however, you will still see results if you begin to wear your girdle at any time during the first 6 months after the delivery.

Here's why: Still present after childbirth for up to 6 months are hormones secreted during pregnancy. These hormones, Estrogen, progesterone and relaxin loosen the abdominal muscles, the pelvic structure and supporting ligaments and joints. Bellefit works together with your body's natural process of recovery. The Girdle/Corset acts to retract the body by drawing in stretched muscles and provides medical-grade compression to your abdominal area. We have even heard great testimonies from Moms that began using Bellefit up to 8-10 months postpartum and were able to benefit greatly from its use.

response.Description:
The premium quality Postpartum Bikini by Bellefit has a seamless low-rise design made of breathable microporous fabric and provides light compression and a comfortable anatomical fit.

It is perfect to use on its own or underneath a Bellefit postpartum girdle or corset. Use the Postpartum Bikini for a comfortable fit and support around the house or while your Bellefit corset or girdle is being washed.

The front of the Postpartum Bikini consists of a two-ply reinforced design that offers crucial support to the frontal lower abdominal and oblique areas.

90% Pima Cotton and 10% Elastane

Care Instructions
Latex-free | Hand Wash with Soft Soap | Do Not Wring or Twist | Do Not Use Bleach | No Dryer or Iron | Dry Flat

• This premium quality Postpartum Brief by Bellefit has a seamless medium-rise design made with the postpartum woman in mind. The brief reaches just above the lower abdomen to provide light and comfortable anatomical fit and support.
• It is perfect to wear as you transition from wearing the Postpartum Panty which offers greater all-around compression or daily with a Bellefit postpartum girdle or corset.
• Wear the Bellefit Postpartum Brief for comfortable fit and support around the house or while your Bellefit corset or girdle is being washed.
• The front of the postpartum brief consists of a two-ply reinforced design that offers support to the frontal lower abdominal area.
• 90% Pima Cotton for extra soft feel and 10% Elastane, resulting in a breathable and durable microporous fabric that won’t itch or cause discomfort.

Care Instructions
Latex-free | Hand Wash with Soft Soap | Do Not Wring or Twist | Do Not Use Bleach | No Dryer or Iron | Dry Flat

response.Description:
The Bellefit Bundle #6 includes a Girdle with zipper and a Girdle Pull-up.

Why a bundle?
We offer our Bundles where you can order more than one size or style at a discounted rate! When close to or more than 33lbs are gained, we recommend going up one size for the initial stages of the recovery. Most moms do end up needing more than one size to complete their recovery process. Some women also choose a Bundle because they want the flexibility of having more than one style available to wear or just to have a backup to wear while the other one is being washed.

When ordering a bundle of two sizes, always try the smaller girdle first to make sure that the larger one is needed. It is better to have a girdle that may be a little snug at first than one that is too loose.
response.ExtraField6:
When purchasing this bundle in multiple sizes, we generally recommend the Girdle with zipper in the larger size and the Girdle Pull-up in the smaller size.

Girdle with zipper Features:
The Girdle with Zipper has a lateral zipper on the side with two sets of hook and eye closures underneath. They are separated by an inch apart and can be adjusted so as time goes by, you can tighten your girdle when additional compression is needed.

Although we do recommend this style for women that have had a Natural delivery, many moms do choose to wear the Girdle with Zipper after a C-Section as well!

Girdle Pull-up Features:
The Girdle Pull-up has a simple and traditional design without any hooks or zippers. Ideal for Moms that have a natural delivery and would like this basic and efficient design. Please keep in mind that the Pull-up is the only girdle not recommended in the case of a c-section.

response.ExtraField12:
When should I purchase a Bundle?
Bellefit Bundles offer savings to women who have gained close to or more than 33lbs during their pregnancy. Women who fall under this category will require 2 sizes in order to receive continuous abdominal compression throughout the childbirth recovery process. Some women choose bundles because they want the flexibility of having more than one style available to wear, and in many cases women also like to have a second girdle to use while washing. During weeks 1-3 after childbirth, the larger-sized girdle is used to provide immediate postpartum compression before going down one size to complete the recovery process. Visit our Bundles page to learn more.

I have had a dramatic weight gain during my pregnancy, what is my best option?
If this is your case then we recommend a Bellefit Bundle, which consists of 2 girdles, one larger for the initial stages of your recovery, and a smaller one after you have dropped one size in order to complete the childbirth recovery process.

I don't know if I will have a c-section or natural birth, what design do I choose?
All four Bellefit girdle designs provide the same benefits; the only difference is the closure method of the girdles. We recommend purchasing a Dual-Closure Girdle if your delivery method is uncertain. The Bellefit Corset is also recommended if your delivery method is uncertain.

What is the difference between the Girdles?
  • Dual The Dual-Closure girdle can be used after a C-section or Natural birth. It combines the closure methods of the Corset and the Girdle with Zipper. The dual-closure girdle has the hooks in the front (as in the corset) and the lateral zipper (as in the girdle with zipper). This girdle is preferred by many Moms who are seeking the highest level of flexibility and adjustability throughout the postpartum recovery process.
  • Corset To protect and accommodate your incision scar, the Corset has hook-and-eye closures in the front. The Corsets are adjustable and have two rows of hook and eye closures that are separated by an inch apart. They can be adjusted so as time goes by, you can tighten your girdle when additional compression is needed. This design is also good for the Moms that are planning a natural birth but a c-section is still possible.
  • Zipper The Girdle with zipper has a lateral zipper which allows for a simple closure for smaller sizes. The Girdle with Zipper is adjustable and has two sets of hook and eye closures underneath the zipper that are separated by an inch apart. They can be adjusted so as time goes by, you can tighten your girdle when additional compression is needed. This design is also good for the Moms that are planning a natural birth but a c-section is still possible. The C-Section Incision must have healed for the Girdle with Zipper to be worn comfortably. For C-Section recovery, it is optimal to use the Corset or Dual Closure.
  • Pull-up The Girdle Pull-Up has a simple and traditional design with no closures, except for the crotch area flap. This style is ideal for Moms that have had a vaginal childbirth and would like this basic and efficient design. The Pull-Up is not recommended for c-section recovery.

response.Description: The Dual-Closure girdle, also known as the "Double Corset" combines the benefits of the Corset and the Girdle with Zipper in one girdle. The option of a lateral zipper and the hook and eye closures in the front provides the most flexibility after a c-section or natural delivery.

response.ExtraField6:
Directions
Begin wearing after birth on the day that you are discharged from the hospital. It's optimal to begin wearing Bellefit right after birth; however, you will still see results if you begin to wear your girdle at any time during the first 6 months after the delivery.

Here's why: Still present after childbirth for up to 6 months are hormones secreted during pregnancy. These hormones, Estrogen, progesterone and relaxin loosen the abdominal muscles, the pelvic structure and supporting ligaments and joints. Bellefit works together with your body's natural process of recovery.

The Girdle/Corset acts to retract the body by drawing in stretched muscles and provides medical-grade compression to your abdominal area. We have even heard great testimonies from Moms that began using Bellefit up to 8-10 months postpartum and were able to benefit greatly from its use.

response.ExtraField12:
• What is the difference between the Corset and the Dual-Closure?
    The Dual Closure has two rows of hook and eye closures in the front that are separated by an inch apart and a lateral zipper on the side with two sets of hook and eye closures underneath. .

    As your body transforms after your delivery, you can adjust the settings when slightly more or less compression is needed. Many moms love the option of both closures to not only get the highest level for flexibility, but to also decide which closure method is most convenient throughout the recovery process.

    The Dual-Closure also has a convenient crotch are closure that allows you to use the restroom or change your underwear and pads comfortably without needing to take it off each time.

  • Can I wear a Dual-Closure after a c-section?
    Yes! The front hook and eye closures of the Dual-Closure are designed with the incision in mind.

  • What are the main benefits of the Dual-Closure?
    The main difference between the two styles is that the Dual-Closure (also known as a Double Corset) has the side zipper closure as well. Underneath the zipper are two sets of adjustable hook and eye closures (one near the top and one near the bottom).

    Because it has both closure options, the Dual-Closure is able to be adjusted the most out of all of the other styles. Many moms like having the option of both closures in one girdle to also be able to choose which method is more convenient for them throughout their recovery. For example, in the beginning when your swelling is at its peak, you may find that it is easier for you to use just the front closure. Once you get a little farther along you may find that just using the zipper closure is more convenient for you.

  • Can I wear a Dual-Closure after a c-section?
    Yes! The front hook and eye closures of the Dual-Closure are designed with the incision in mind.

  • I had a natural delivery. Can I still use the Dual-Closure style?
    Yes! The Dual-Closure is an excellent option for either delivery method.

  • I am unsure of my delivery method. Is the Dual-Closure still recommended?
    Yes! The Dual-Closure is an excellent option for either delivery method.

  • Can you see it underneath my clothes?
    The Dual-Closure is not bulky and is flush with your skin; however because of the front closure location, it may be slightly visible underneath certain fabrics or if you are wearing a fitted top. Keep in mind though that your comfort and healing process is the most important factor!

  • I am not pregnant but have had abdominal surgery. Can I still use the Dual-Closure style?
    Yes! Keep in mind though that we generally recommend a Girdle with Hooks (Corset) after an abdominal surgery that may or may not be related to pregnancy. As always, consult with your physician to make sure that a compression garment is the best choice for your recovery.

  • Is the Dual-Closure adjustable?
    The Dual Closure has two rows of hook and eye closures in the front that are separated by an inch apart and a lateral zipper on the side with two sets of hook and eye closures underneath.

    As your body transforms after your delivery, you can adjust the settings when slightly more or less compression is needed.

  • What body type is best for a Dual-Closure?
    Since the Dual-Closure is adjustable, it is suitable for all body type shapes. (Triangle/Inverted Triangle/Hourglass/Rectangle)

  • When can I start wearing my Dual-Closure?
    Begin wearing your Dual-Closure the day that you are discharged from the hospital or as soon as you are ready to wear it after the delivery. It's optimal to begin wearing Bellefit right after birth; however, you will still see results if you begin to wear your girdle at any time during the first 6 months after the delivery. As always, consult with your physician to make sure the Dual-Closure is right for you since every recovery process is so unique.
